tasks.title: Set up modular directory structure
tasks.description: Create the new directory structure with core/, frontend/, editor/, admin/, utils/, third-party/, and globals/ directories with index.ts barrel exports
tasks.details: Create the foundational directory structure for the refactored Elementor types library. This includes creating all main directories and their index.ts files to establish the modular organization pattern.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all directories are created and index.ts files can be imported without errors

tasks.title: Extract core module system types
tasks.description: Move Module, ViewModule, ArgsObject, and related core classes from types.ts to core/ directory
tasks.details: Extract the core ElementorModules namespace and all related classes including Module, ViewModule, ArgsObject, InstanceType, and ForceMethodImplementation from the monolithic types.ts file into the new core/ directory structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure all core module types compile correctly and can be imported from the new location

tasks.title: Extract frontend types and configuration
tasks.description: Move ElementorFrontend, ElementorFrontendConfig, and related frontend types to frontend/ directory
tasks.details: Separate all frontend-related types including the main ElementorFrontend interface, configuration types, and utility interfaces into the frontend module structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify frontend types are accessible and IntelliSense works correctly for frontend imports

tasks.title: Extract and organize handler types
tasks.description: Move all handler-related types (BaseHandler, SwiperHandler, etc.) to frontend/handlers/ directory
tasks.details: Organize all element handlers, widget handlers, and specialized handlers like SwiperHandler into a dedicated handlers subdirectory within frontend.
tasks.testStrategy: Confirm all handler types are properly exported and can be imported for widget development

tasks.title: Extract editor types and components
tasks.description: Move ElementorEditor, Panel, HistoryManager, and other editor types to editor/ directory
tasks.details: Separate all editor-specific types including the main editor interface, panel components, history management, and editor utilities into the editor module.
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure editor plugin development can import necessary types from the new editor module

tasks.title: Extract command system types
tasks.description: Move the $e namespace and command system types to editor/commands/ directory
tasks.details: Organize the entire command system including the $e namespace, component registry, routes, and command execution types into a dedicated commands module.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify command system types work correctly for editor command development

tasks.title: Extract control system types
tasks.description: Move all control-related types and interfaces to editor/controls/ directory
tasks.details: Organize all control types, base control classes, and control-specific interfaces into the controls module for better organization of the editor control system.
tasks.testStrategy: Confirm control types are properly accessible for custom control development

tasks.title: Extract utility types and helpers
tasks.description: Move shared utilities like hooks, events, and breakpoints to utils/ directory
tasks.details: Separate all shared utility types including hooks system, event handling, breakpoint management, and other cross-cutting concerns into the utils module.
tasks.testStrategy: Ensure utility types are accessible from multiple modules and work correctly

tasks.title: Extract third-party integration types
tasks.description: Move Swiper, jQuery augmentations, and other third-party types to third-party/ directory
tasks.details: Organize all third-party library integrations including Swiper extensions, jQuery augmentations, and other external library type definitions.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify third-party integrations work correctly and don't conflict with base library types

tasks.title: Extract global declarations
tasks.description: Move Window interface augmentations and global declarations to globals/ directory
tasks.details: Separate all global type augmentations including Window interface extensions, global variable declarations, and ambient module declarations.
tasks.testStrategy: Confirm global declarations are properly applied and accessible throughout the type system

tasks.title: Create comprehensive index.ts with export strategy
tasks.description: Build the main index.ts file with namespace exports and direct exports for the new modular structure
tasks.details: Create a comprehensive index.ts that provides multiple export patterns: namespace exports for grouped access, direct exports for common types, and helper types. This will be the single source of truth for all type exports.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all import patterns work correctly and IntelliSense provides appropriate suggestions

tasks.title: Add helper types and type guards
tasks.description: Create utility types like ElementSettings, ResponsiveValue, and type guard functions
tasks.details: Add developer-friendly helper types and utility functions to improve the developer experience, including generic types for element settings and responsive values.
tasks.testStrategy: Test helper types work correctly in typical usage scenarios and provide good IntelliSense

tasks.title: Add comprehensive JSDoc documentation
tasks.description: Add detailed JSDoc comments to key interfaces and provide usage examples
tasks.details: Add comprehensive documentation including JSDoc comments for all major interfaces, usage examples for common scenarios, and developer guidance for the new modular structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify documentation appears correctly in IntelliSense and provides helpful guidance to developers

tasks.title: Validate TypeScript compilation and testing
tasks.description: Ensure all modules compile correctly and set up type testing infrastructure
tasks.details: Validate that the entire refactored type system compiles correctly, all imports resolve properly, and set up infrastructure for ongoing type testing.
tasks.testStrategy: Run TypeScript compilation, import resolution tests, and verify no regression in type checking behavior

tasks.title: Complete Type Inventory Analysis
tasks.description: Extract and catalog all type definitions from original src/types.ts file
tasks.details: Systematically parse the original src/types.ts file to create a complete inventory of all interfaces, classes, enums, type aliases, namespaces, and exports. Document each type's name, location, signature, and dependencies.

tasks.title: Export Accessibility Verification
tasks.description: Verify all types from original file are accessible in new modular structure
tasks.details: Test that every type identified in the inventory can be imported and used from the new modular structure. Check direct imports, namespace imports, and barrel exports.

tasks.title: Type Signature Validation
tasks.description: Compare type signatures between original and refactored versions
tasks.details: Verify that method signatures, property types, optional/required status, generic parameters, and inheritance relationships are exactly preserved in the refactored version.

tasks.title: Namespace Structure Verification
tasks.description: Verify namespace structure preservation and accessibility
tasks.details: Check that all original namespaces (ElementorModules, $e, etc.) are preserved or properly converted. Ensure nested namespace hierarchies work and cross-namespace references resolve correctly.

tasks.title: Module Integration Testing
tasks.description: Test cross-module dependencies and type relationships
tasks.details: Verify that types referencing other types across modules work correctly. Test circular dependency resolution, type augmentations, and global declarations merge properly.

tasks.title: Build and Declaration Verification
tasks.description: Verify TypeScript compilation and generated declarations
tasks.details: Ensure TypeScript compilation produces no errors or warnings. Verify generated declaration files include all types and that IntelliSense provides complete type information.

tasks.title: Legacy Compatibility Testing
tasks.description: Test backward compatibility for existing consumers
tasks.details: Verify that existing import patterns still work and that no breaking changes were introduced. Test legacy usage scenarios and ensure migration path is seamless.

tasks.title: Final Parity Certification Report
tasks.description: Generate comprehensive parity verification report
tasks.details: Compile all verification results into a comprehensive report documenting 100% parity achievement, any improvements made, and certification that the refactored version is ready for production use.

metadata.description: Tasks for verifying 100% parity between refactored modular structure and original monolithic types.ts file

tasks.title: Create Comprehensive Export Verification Test
tasks.description: Create a test file that imports every single type from the legacy namespace and attempts to import the same types from the new modular structure
tasks.details: Build a comprehensive test that tries to import all types from both legacy/types.ts and the new src/ structure to identify missing exports. This will be our baseline for measuring 100% coverage.

tasks.title: Verify Core Elements System Export
tasks.description: Verify that all element types from elementor-dev-js/editor/elements/types are properly exported from the modular structure
tasks.details: Check that ElementBase, Section, Column, Widget, Container, Document and ElementsManager from the JS codebase are accessible through the new TypeScript structure. Ensure the inheritance hierarchy is preserved.

tasks.title: Audit Control System Exports
tasks.description: Verify all ~30+ control types are exported from the new modular structure
tasks.details: Audit all control types from elementor-dev-js/editor/controls directory. Check control behaviors, validation, and responsive control functionality. Ensure all base classes like BaseControl, BaseData, BaseMultiple are properly exported.

tasks.title: Complete Browser Import System Types
tasks.description: Map the entire browser-import component system to TypeScript
tasks.details: Analyze elementor-dev-js/editor/components/browser-import and ensure all classes are typed: FileReaderBase, FileParserBase, all specific parsers, Manager, Normalizer, and Component classes. This is a complex system that needs complete coverage.

tasks.title: Document Command System Coverage
tasks.description: Map all commands in the $e system and verify complete command coverage
tasks.details: Document all commands from the JS codebase including document commands, panel commands, UI commands. Verify that all command base classes and the complete command registration system are properly typed.

tasks.title: Verify Component Registration System
tasks.description: Verify component registration system types and lifecycle coverage
tasks.details: Check that all component registration methods are typed. Verify the component lifecycle is fully covered including component initialization, registration, and management patterns used throughout the codebase.

tasks.title: Complete Handler System Audit
tasks.description: Complete audit of all handler types from elementor-dev-js/frontend/handlers
tasks.details: Verify all handler types including widget-specific handlers, Swiper-based handlers, and the base handler system. Ensure the complete frontend handler architecture is properly typed and accessible.

tasks.title: Add Missing Utility Classes
tasks.description: Add missing utility classes like Masonry and Scroll if they're used in the codebase
tasks.details: Search the JS codebase for utility classes that may be missing from our types. Add Masonry, Scroll utilities, and verify NProgress integration types if they're actually used. Document any utility classes we may have missed.

tasks.title: Migration Path Documentation
tasks.description: Create clear migration examples from legacy imports to new modular imports
tasks.details: Document migration paths with specific examples. Create a migration guide showing how to transition from legacy namespace imports to the new modular structure. Include examples for common use cases and document any breaking changes.

tasks.title: Final Coverage Report Update
tasks.description: Update final coverage report with actual verification results and remove premature coverage claims
tasks.details: Update the existing coverage report with real verification results from our testing. Remove any "100% coverage" claims until actually verified. Add specific examples of successful imports and document the verified coverage percentage.

metadata.description: Tasks for achieving 100% TypeScript coverage of the Elementor JS codebase

tasks.title: Create comprehensive export verification test
tasks.description: Create a test file that attempts to import every type and interface from the legacy namespace and current modular structure to identify gaps
tasks.details:
Create a test file in tests/ or a similar location that systematically imports every single type from:
1. Legacy namespace (legacy/types.ts)
2. Current modular structure (src/*)
3. Compare coverage and document missing exports
4. This will serve as the baseline for our 100% coverage goal

tasks.title: Complete core elements system types
tasks.description: Map and type all element types from elementor-dev-js/editor/elements/types including ElementBase, Section, Column, Widget, Container, Document classes
tasks.details:
Analyze elementor-dev-js/editor/elements/types/ directory and ensure complete coverage of:
- ElementBase class and its methods
- Section, Column, Widget, Container, Document element types
- Element inheritance hierarchy
- ElementsManager class
- All element-related interfaces and methods
Focus on creating clean, modern TypeScript definitions without legacy concerns

tasks.title: Complete control system types coverage
tasks.description: Create comprehensive types for all control types found in elementor-dev-js/editor/controls/ directory
tasks.details:
Map all control types from elementor-dev-js/editor/controls/:
- Base control classes (base-data.js, base-multiple.js, etc.)
- All specific control types (~30+ controls)
- Control behaviors and validation
- Responsive control functionality
- Control settings and options interfaces
Create modern TypeScript definitions for the entire control system

tasks.title: Complete browser import system types
tasks.description: Type the browser import system from elementor-dev-js/editor/components/browser-import/
tasks.details:
Create complete TypeScript coverage for the browser import system:
- FileReaderBase and FileParserBase classes
- All specific file parsers (CSV, JSON, etc.)
- Browser import Manager class
- Normalizer functionality
- Import component classes
- File processing interfaces and types
Focus on clean, modern type definitions

tasks.title: Complete command system types
tasks.description: Create comprehensive types for the Elementor command system including all $e commands and command base classes
tasks.details:
Map the entire command system:
- Command base classes from elementor-dev-js/editor/command-bases/
- All document commands, panel commands, etc.
- The $e command registration and execution system
- Command arguments and return types
- Command lifecycle and hooks
Create modern TypeScript definitions for the command architecture

tasks.title: Complete frontend handlers system types
tasks.description: Create types for all frontend handlers from elementor-dev-js/frontend/handlers/ directory
tasks.details:
Complete frontend handler system coverage:
- Base handler classes
- Widget-specific handlers
- Global handlers (scroll, sticky, etc.)
- Swiper-based handlers and integration
- Handler registration and lifecycle
- Handler settings and configuration interfaces
Create clean TypeScript definitions for the entire frontend handler system

tasks.title: Complete editor components types
tasks.description: Type all editor components from elementor-dev-js/editor/components/ including template library, dynamic tags, hotkeys, etc.
tasks.details:
Create comprehensive coverage for editor components:
- Template library component and its subcomponents
- Dynamic tags system
- Hotkeys management
- Icons manager
- Preview components
- Selection system
- Settings components
- Validator component
- Component registration and lifecycle
Focus on modern TypeScript definitions without legacy concerns

tasks.title: Modernize export structure
tasks.description: Reorganize and modernize the export structure from src/index.ts to provide clean, tree-shakeable exports
tasks.details:
After completing all component types, reorganize the main export structure:
- Clean up src/index.ts with logical export groups
- Ensure all new types are properly exported
- Create sub-index files for major areas (editor/, frontend/, etc.)
- Remove dependency on legacy namespace
- Optimize for tree-shaking and modern bundlers
- Create clear import paths for consumers

tasks.title: Final verification and coverage report
tasks.description: Run final verification test and create comprehensive coverage report
tasks.details:
Final verification and documentation:
- Run the comprehensive export test from task 1
- Verify 100% coverage achieved
- Create detailed coverage report
- Document any remaining gaps or limitations
- Update package.json and README
- Prepare for publishing if needed
- Clean up any legacy files that are no longer needed

tasks.title: Improve ElementorFrontendHandlers types
tasks.description: Replace 'any' types in ElementorFrontendHandlers interface with proper TypeScript interfaces based on JavaScript handlers
tasks.details:
1. Analyze handlers in elementor-dev-js/frontend/handlers/ directory
2. Create proper interface for Base handler class with methods like getDefaultSettings, getDefaultElements, onInit, bindEvents
3. Create interface for StretchedElement handler
4. Create interface for SwiperBase handler with Swiper-specific methods
5. Create interface for CarouselBase handler
6. Update ElementorFrontendHandlers in src/globals/elementor-modules.ts to use these interfaces

tasks.title: Improve ElementorFrontendTools types
tasks.description: Replace 'any' type in ElementorFrontendTools interface with proper TypeScript interface for StretchElement utility
tasks.details:
1. Analyze the StretchElement utility in elementor-dev-js to understand its methods and properties
2. Create proper interface for StretchElement utility
3. Update ElementorFrontendTools in src/globals/elementor-modules.ts to use the interface
4. Add verification test to ensure the improved types work correctly

tasks.title: Add core control types (Critical Priority)
tasks.description: Add comprehensive types for core control classes (select, number, color, media, slider controls)
tasks.details:
1. Analyze control JavaScript files in elementor-dev-js/editor/controls/ for select, number, color, media, slider
2. Create TypeScript interfaces for each control class with proper methods and properties
3. Add these to src/editor/controls/ directory as separate files or enhance existing files
4. Update imports and exports to make these available
5. Create verification tests for the new control types

tasks.title: Add common widget handler types
tasks.description: Complete frontend widget handler types for common widgets (counter, tabs, toggle, video, background-slideshow)
tasks.details:
1. Analyze common handler JavaScript files in elementor-dev-js/frontend/handlers/ 
2. Create specific interfaces for Counter, Tabs, Toggle, Video, BackgroundSlideshow handlers
3. Add these interfaces to src/frontend/handlers/ directory 
4. Update the main handler exports to include these new types
5. Create verification tests showing how to extend these handlers

tasks.title: Improve ElementorEditor namespace types
tasks.description: Improve ElementorEditor namespace with proper types for Container, utils, elements, and views
tasks.details:
1. Analyze editor JavaScript files to understand Container class, utils, elements, and views structures
2. Replace 'any' types in ElementorEditor interface with proper interfaces
3. Create separate interface files for complex editor components
4. Update src/globals/elementor-modules.ts with improved types
5. Add verification tests for editor namespace improvements

metadata.description: Tasks for achieving 100% TypeScript coverage of Elementor JS codebase
